fields.headline: PR Week
fields.bodyText: Weber Shandwick has hired TV political editor Andrew Brown - the latest in a string of high profile journalists to join its strategic media relations division. The editor of the British Medical Journal has defended last week's controversial issue, which branded the relationship between doctors and pharmaceutical firms and the use of promotional activity as "grubby". The Shine Communications managing director, Michael Frolich, has quit to set up a spin-off PR venture for Lord Bell's Chime Communications. Telewest has hired financial PR adviser Citigate Dewe Rogerson to help revamp its corporate communications efforts. Cable & Wireless is to review its entire UK communications operation following the decision to shed 1,500 jobs. Camelot is to relocate its PR team from Hertfordshire to central London in an attempt to turn around the Lotto's media fortunes. Finsbury has secured first place in the UK mergers and acquisitions adviser league for the first time in nine months.
